name: certificate.services
description: Service entities, as the name implies, are abstractions of each of your own upstream services. Examples of Services would be a data transformation microservice, a billing API, etc.

fields.name: retries
fields.help: The number of retries to execute upon failure to proxy. Defaults to 5.

fields.name: protocol
fields.help: The protocol used to communicate with the upstream. It can be one of http or https. Defaults to "http".

fields.name: host
fields.help: The host of the upstream server.

fields.name: port
fields.help: The upstream server port. Defaults to 80.

fields.name: path
fields.help: The path to be used in requests to the upstream server.

fields.name: connect_timeout
fields.help: The timeout in milliseconds for establishing a connection to the upstream server. Defaults to 60000.

fields.name: write_timeout
fields.help: The timeout in milliseconds between two successive write operations for transmitting a request to the upstream server. Defaults to 60000.

fields.name: read_timeout
fields.help: The timeout in milliseconds between two successive read operations for transmitting a request to the upstream server. Defaults to 60000.

fields.name: tags
fields.help: An optional set of strings associated with the Service, for grouping and filtering.
